rundown: 3-8 L @ Texas Rangers Joey Wentz: 4.1 innings, 3 earned runs, 4 hits, 1 HR, 6 strikeouts Batters: Michael Harris II (2 hits - 4 AB, 1 HR, 1 RBI) Jurickson Profar (1 hit - 3 AB, 1 RBI) The Braves fell to the Texas Rangers with a final score of 3-8. The team struggled to keep up with the Rangers' offense, allowing 8 runs while only managing 3 of their own. Key highlights from the game include: 1. Michael Harris II had a standout performance, hitting a home run and scoring twice. 2. Joey Wentz pitched 4.1 innings but allowed 3 earned runs, contributing to the team's loss. 3. The Braves managed only 6 hits compared to the Rangers' 8, indicating a lack of offensive production.
